ygData.subject: Re:  Data
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The Psalms stack with Guardian Rhythms (dunno if the Psalm of Mystic Shielding does).  That s why folks are suggesting them as a two-pronged resist
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 27 Dec 1999, Benjamin Jerrad Segal wrote:
>
> When in an area with casters, I will tend toward Guardian and Elemental
> Rhythms with drum. The psalms don't stack with anything
> resistance-related, and I love how people oggle when their MR jumps 100
> points.

The Psalms stack with Guardian Rhythms (dunno if the Psalm of
Mystic Shielding does). That's why folks are suggesting them
as a two-pronged resist approach - Psalm for one resist,
Guardian for MR.

> I could be using weapons and a psalm, but my philosophy is if the caster
> is barely scratching us anyway, it doesn't matter if it takes a few more
> seconds to kill it.

I've found resists to be most important at the beginning of a
fight, when the puller is coming in damaged. Either the
puller, the healer, or the bard is going to get nuked by any
extra casters that come along - before an enchanter or bard
can do crowd control.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
